PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12, 1941, pg. 3, reads: "Roy Eldridge: Young Man With A Horn...A few years ago Roy Eldridge was just another musician around Pittsburgh, playing in local night spots and doing whatever he could to get along.  Last week he came home with colors flying and hailed as one of the greatest trumpet players in world.  Now a member of Gene Krupa's famous orchestra, the only Negro member of the aggregation, Roy Eldridge is on top in the music world.  Pictures were taken backstage at the Stanley last week.... Top, left: Roy jams with orchestra members backstage just before show time.  Krupa's men spend almost as much time jamming as they do at regular work... - Harris photos."
TitMainTitle: Musicians gathered around Roy Eldridge playing trumpet, backstage of the Stanley Theatre
